captions.text:
I guess you've heard by now (beep beep) Auto
Power off? Why the f- Still some glitches

to work out. Hello John, by now you have received
my message that we will no longer be communicating

through any textual means. No more instant
messaging, no more emailing, only video blogging.
You can see my eye in my eye. Aaaahhhh.

Okay, just try to ignore that. There, you
can't see it now, can you?

Last night I sent you an email from a New
Year's Eve party in Lake Tahoe. The email

outlined our plans. Starting on January 1st,
today, I will send you a video blog. Tomorrow

you will reply to that video blog. We will
continue like this until the year is up.

If one of us fails to send a video blog on
a weekday, there will be certain punishments.

The punishments will be outlined later. I
finished this email: cross my heart, hope

to die, and I may very possibly be required
to stick a needle in my eye. That's the kind

["Crazy" by Gnarls Barkley is heard playing
in the background]
Does that make us crazy? Probably.

fame, and a higher GPA. If not, I will put the hottest pepper in the 
world,Tabasco sauce, seasoned salt, pepper, chilies, and 25 sourheads in a 
blender and drink it. All of it. If I do survive, I will post my reactions 
on youtube. Wish me godspeed. ﻿

comments.author: Andrew Marsden

comments.text:
+Andrew Marsden As it turns out, copyright infringement is not very 
difficult to do. I got hit with it on the second episode of my vlog for 
using Nintendo music in the credits. Ironically, the outtakes video for 
that episode used the same song through the whole video with no problem 
(probably because I was talking over it). Gotta be more careful I guess.

comments.author: Mia George

comments.text:
I was in 8th grade during this videos inception. Gnarls Barkley was 
popular. I wonder how my life would be different if I found this video back 
then and discovered the wonders of online communities outside of Myspace. 
The only video I knew or cared about was hosted by ebaumsworld. Or if I had 
somehow come across Looking for Alaska before my high school career had 
ended. Everything about this is awesomely awesome. Thank you both for your 
contribution. You have reminded and inspired a massive amount of people to 
be awesome, including myself. I used to think I was weird for reading, 
studying history, or being curious and questioning the world around me.You 
demonstrated the innate coolness of being a nerd. You showed me it is cool 
to be yourself.﻿
